newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Electrafina declines comment on Suez.
newsitem.headline: Electrafina declines comment on Suez.

text.p: Belgian holding company Electrafina declined to comment on Friday on the future of its 8.3 percent stake in Cie de Suez as the French company said it would discuss a merger with Lyonnaise des Eaux on April 11.

Electrafina, an investment vehicle of Belgian financier Albert Frere's Groupe Bruxelles Lambert, surprised analysts when it announced last week, in a statement on 1996 results, that it owned so much of Suez; the company had previously said it held at least five percent of the company.

"I think the reason Electrafina and Groupe Frere took such a high level is that they anticipated a Suez/Lyonnaise merger, as a result of which Electrafina's stake will be diluted to the level of other shareholders," one analyst said. He declined to be named.
